skill.name: blitz

Use when tackling multiple GitHub issues simultaneously, when the user mentions "blitz", "parallel sprint", "worktree workflow", or when handling 3+ independent issues that could be worked on concurrently. Orchestrates the full workflow from issue triage through parallel agent delegation to sequential merge.

content.user_title: Run parallel agent sprints with git worktrees
content.value_statement: Tackle multiple GitHub issues simultaneously by running independent Claude agents in isolated git worktrees. Each agent creates a PR, self-reviews, and PRs are sequentially merged to avoid conflicts.
actual_capabilities: Orchestrates parallel multi-issue sprints with git worktrees
Creates isolated worktrees for each independent issue
Delegates work to parallel Claude agents with full issue context
Manages sequential PR merge workflow with rebase
Provides quality gates for 100% issue coverage and 10/10 reviews
Handles GitHub issue triage and status management
limitations: Requires gh CLI authenticated and git 2.5+ with worktree support
Agents cannot resume after API disconnection mid-task
PRs must be merged sequentially to avoid conflicts
Agents work in isolation without direct access to other worktrees

use_cases.title: Parallel feature development
use_cases.description: Coordinate multiple developers or agents working on independent features simultaneously without merge conflicts

use_cases.title: Multi-issue sprint triaging
use_cases.description: Triage and resolve multiple backlog issues in parallel by delegating to separate agents

use_cases.title: Concurrent bug fix workflow
use_cases.description: Fix multiple unrelated bugs in the same release cycle using parallel worktrees

prompt_templates.title: Launch parallel agents
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the blitz skill to run a parallel sprint for these issues: #123, #124, #125. Each agent should get complete issue context and use the 4-step-program skill.

prompt_templates.title: Resume agent after gap
prompt_templates.prompt: Agent for issue #123 was disconnected. Check worktree state at .worktrees/issue-123 and spawn fresh agent with full context of what was already done.

prompt_templates.title: Verify coverage gate
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the FINAL COVERAGE GATE for PR #45. Extract ALL requirements from issue #123 and verify line-by-line that each is implemented in the PR.

prompt_templates.title: Sequential merge workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Merge the 4 completed PRs sequentially using the blitz workflow. Rebase each onto updated main before squash merge.

output_examples.input: Run a blitz sprint for issues #42, #43, #44
output: ✓ Launched 3 parallel agents with complete issue context
✓ Agent 1: PR #45 created with 100% coverage, 10/10 review
✓ Agent 2: PR #46 created with 100% coverage, 10/10 review
✓ Agent 3: PR #47 created with 100% coverage, 10/10 review
→ Ready for sequential merge starting with #45

best_practices: Always extract ALL requirements from each issue before delegating to agents
Use absolute paths for worktree directories in agent prompts
Verify 100% coverage gate before merging any PR
anti_patterns: Skipping issue requirement extraction - agents need complete context
Merging PRs in parallel - causes conflicts
Not monitoring agent review status - issues may not fully resolve

faq.question: What tools are required to use this skill?
faq.answer: GitHub CLI (authenticated), git 2.5+ with worktree support, and Claude Code with Task tool for agent spawning.

faq.question: How many issues can I tackle in parallel?
faq.answer: There is no hard limit, but practical limits depend on your system resources and API rate limits.

faq.question: How does this integrate with other skills?
faq.answer: It requires 4-step-program for agent workflow and code-reviewer for self-review quality gates. Delphi is optional for issue triage.

faq.question: Is my code or data exposed to third parties?
faq.answer: No. All operations run locally with your git and gh CLI. No external services are called by this skill.

faq.question: What happens if an agent disconnects mid-task?
faq.answer: Claude agents cannot resume after disconnection. You must spawn a fresh agent with context of the current state.

faq.question: How is this different from running multiple terminals?
faq.answer: Worktrees provide complete filesystem isolation so agents cannot interfere with each other's node_modules, builds, or file changes.
